TextElement::Listener Class Reference

#include <TextElement.h>

Inheritance diagram for TextElement::Listener:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The listener interface for text element events.

Note:
The listener concept has been designed for two clients: The main application (e.g. the game) and the skin. Do not create listeners for internal purposes.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any component anymore. So you should not hold any references to them.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

virtual ~Listener (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Destroys the listener.

Since listeners are managed automatically, you do not need to destroy them by yourself.

Called when the text of a text element has been changed.

Parameters:

onTextChanging()

virtual VetoMode onTextChanging (  TextElement *  element,
const String &  newText
)  [virtual]
 

Called when the text of a text element is about to be changed.

The listener may cancel this event by vetoing it.

Parameters:
element The element that received the event.
newText The new text for the text element.
Returns:
The veto mode, VETO or NO_VETO.
See also:
VetoMode
